patterns: When do currently enrolled participants get registered for the next semester?
When do fresh participants get registered for courses?
How much course load can a participant take in a semester?
When and how can a participant make changes in registration?
What if the registration period is over but registration is unsuccessful?
responses: Course registration of continuing participants for the upcoming semester is done in advance, i.e. 2 weeks before the commencement of the next semester. Participants will register online through Student Portal.

The course registration of undergraduate programs for fresh participants will be done automatically.Fresh participants of MS/MPhil/PhD program participants can enroll on Orientation Day and during the first week of their classes.

A participant is required to register for courses as per Institutes/School offerings. The participant may register for up to 18 credit hours in undergraduate programs and 12 credit hours in graduate programs, in a regular semester irrespective of their CGPA.In the summer session, only two courses or up to 8 credit hours (deficiency and repeat courses only) are allowed.

As per Academic Calendar, the change in the courses is allowed during add/drop period only. Section change is permitted during the week of Courses Add/Drop.However, upon commencement of classes, a week is reserved for the Add/Drop of elective courses only with an option to only drop any core course (if required). Course Add or Change of Section of 'Core' courses will not be allowed during this week of Courses Add/Drop. These changes can be made via the Student Portal.
Immediately contact the PRS Help desk for registration.

patterns: How can a participant withdraw from the courses? Furthermore, what is the effect of course withdrawal on CGPA?
What is the difference between course withdrawal and course drop?
responses: A participant can submit a course withdrawal request on the student portal before the deadline mentioned on the academic calendar.The participant will be awarded 'W' in that particular course(s) in the transcript. However, the SGPA/CGPA shall not be affected.Participant has to pay the repeat fee when he/she will register for the course again.

A participant can add/drop any course during the add/drop period. After add/drop period adjustments in course(s) registration is not permissible. The fee for the dropped courses will not be charged.Whereas, course(s) can be withdrawn by the date given in the academic calendar. Participant has to pay the repeat fee when he/she will re-register for the course. They shall be awarded 'W' in that particular course(s) in the transcript. However, the SGPA/CGPA shall not be affected.

patterns: When do I take Readmission in the same program?
What is the Readmission with the issuance of New Student ID policy?
responses: Re-admission fee of Rs. 25,000/- will be applicable to those students who will miss two consecutive semesters without taking the formal approval. I.e. Semester Freeze. In addition, this fee will also apply to those who apply for re-admission in the same program without going through the admission test.

Re-admission, without going through the admission process, is granted to only those Bachelor, Master, MS/MPhil program participants who have been dismissed on academic grounds due to low performance.The participant will have to pay the readmission/new ID issuance fee of Rs. 10,000/- and will respond to the new package.Participants will apply for Readmission through their online student portal.

Re-admission, without going through the admission process, is granted to only those Bachelor and MS/Master participants who have been dismissed on academic grounds.Dismissal based on the expiration of the maximum degree duration from the date of first registration shall also render such participants inadmissible for re-admission.The participant will have to pay the readmission fee of Rs. 25,000/- and will respond to the new package.
